name: MigrateIntegrationToEventOrchestration
description:
Migrate an integration to a different event orchestration.

Move an Integration and its Routing Key from one Event Orchestration to another as specified in the request. Future events will be processed by the new Event Orchestration's Rules. Requires appropriate OAuth permissions.

parameters.name: event_orchestration_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of an Event Orchestration to migrate the integration to.

value_schema.description: The ID of an Event Orchestration.

parameters.name: accept_header_version
parameters.description: Specifies the API version using the `Accept` header for versioning.

value_schema.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

parameters.name: content_type_header
parameters.description: Specifies the media type of the request. Supported value is 'application/json'.

parameters.name: integration_migration_details
parameters.description: JSON object containing the details for migrating the integration, including source orchestration ID, source type, and integration ID.

source_id.description: The ID of the Event Orchestration you'll be moving the Integration away from

source_type.description: The type of of the `source_id` object

integration_id.description: The ID of the Integration you'll be moving

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Pagerduty API.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of an Event Orchestration.

value_schema.description: The ID of an Event Orchestration.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

value_schema.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

source_id.description: The ID of the Event Orchestration you'll be moving the Integration away from

source_type.description: The type of of the `source_id` object

integration_id.description: The ID of the Integration you'll be moving

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
